item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "These things sneak up on him for no reason, these flashes of irrational happiness. It's probably a vitamin deficiency." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "It was mostly sweet," he whispered, "and you were the sweetest of all." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I have said: "Blow out the lamp! Day is here!" And you keep saying: "Give me a lamp so I can find the day." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "When any civilization is dust and ashes," he said, "art is all that's left over. Images, words, music. Imaginative structures. Meaning—human meaning, that is—is defined by them. You have to admit that." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Then she let him lick her fingers for her. He ran his tongue around the small ovals of her nails. This was the closest she could get to him without becoming food: she was in him, or part of her was in part of him. Sex was the other way around: While that was going on, he was in her. I'll make you mine, lovers said in old books. They never said, I'll make you me." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Every child should have love, every person should have it. She herself would rather have had her mother's love - the love she still continued to believe in, the love that had followed her through the jungle in the form of a bird so she would not be too frightened or lonely." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Religion, too, is a weapon. What manner of weapon is religion when it becomes the government?" -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Every habit he's ever had is still there in his body, lying dormant like flowers in the desert. Given the right conditions, all his old addictions would burst into full and luxuriant bloom." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "This myth he'd made out of intricate movements and imagination, out of moonlight and love, out of prayers older than Adam, and gray cliffs and crimson shadows, laments and rivers of martyrs - what had it come to at last? When the waves receded, the shores of Time would spread out there clean, empty, shining with infinite grains of memory and little else." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "We understand more than we know." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "The convoluted wording of legalisms grew up around the necessity to hide from ourselves the violence we intend toward each other. Between depriving a man of one hour from his life and depriving him of his life there exists only a difference of degree. You have done violence to him, consumed his energy. Elaborate euphemisms may conceal your intent to kill, but behind any use of power over another the ultimate assumption remains: "I feed on your energy." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The night was crisp and the stars shone with a cold blue light like loneliness or infinity." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Children see magic because they look for it." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "To exist is to stand out, away from the background," The Preacher said. "You aren't thinking or really existing unless you're willing to risk even your own sanity in the judgment of your existence." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "You are a child seeking to be a man. When you are a man, you will seek in vain for the child you were." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "But one learns from books and reels only that certain things can be done. Actual learning requires that you do those things." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "No matter how much we ask after the truth, self-awareness is often unpleasant. We do not feel kindly toward the Truthsayer." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "We had something few experience. We were joined in our strengths rather than in our weaknesses." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Small souls who seek power over others first destroy the faith those others might have in themselves." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Each of us comes into being knowing who he is and what he is supposed to do.' ... 'Small children know,' Leto said. 'It's only after adults have confused them that children hide this knowledge even from themselves." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "My Uncle Malky always said the Lord Leto never responded to prayer. He said the Lord Leto looked on prayer as attempted coercion, a form of violence against the chosen god, telling the immortal what to do: Give me a miracle, God, or I won't believe in you!" -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "If we deny the need for thought, Moneo, as some do, we lose the powers of reflection; we cannot define what our senses report. If we deny the flesh, we unwheel the vehicle which bears us. But if we deny emotion, we lose all touch with our internal universe. It was emotions which I missed the most." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description:
"You have to appreciate life before you want to preserve it," she said.
"And it's the survivors who maintain the most light and poignant hold upon the beauties of living. Women know this more often than men because birth is the reflection of death." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Police are inevitably corrupted. ... Police always observe that criminals prosper. It takes a pretty dull policeman to miss the fact that the position of authority is the most prosperous criminal position available." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Most men go through life unchallenged, except at the final moment." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Meaghan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Most civilisation is based on cowardice. It's so easy to civilize by teaching cowardice. You water down the standards which would lead to bravery. You restrain the will. You regulate the appetites. You fence in the horizons. You make a law for every movement. You deny the existence of chaos. You teach even the children to breathe slowly. You tame." -- Frank Herbert
